                        # API Reference

                        # _

                        Lodash Mixins

                        # vm._.access(object, key, value)

                        • Arguments:

                          • {Object} object
                          • {String} key
                          • {any} value

                        • Returns:{any}

                        • Usage:

                        Calls vm._.extend(object, { [key]: value }) if vm._.has(object, key) is falsy and returns vm._.get(object, key)

                        • Example:
                        const obj = { foo: 'foo' };

vm._.access(obj, 'foo', 'foo');
// => "foo"
// obj is now {foo: "foo"}

vm._.access(obj, 'bar', 'bar');
// => "bar"
// obj is now {foo: "foo", bar: "bar"}

                        # vm._.encode(string)

                        • Arguments:

                          • {String} string

                        • Returns:{String}

                        • Usage:

                        window.encodeURIComponent alias

                        • Example:
                        vm._.encode('$');
// => "%24"

                        # vm._.decode(string)

                        • Arguments:

                          • {String} string

                        • Returns:{String}

                        • Usage:

                        window.decodeURIComponent alias

                        • Example:
                        vm._.decode('%24');
// => "$"

                        # vm._.param(object, prepend)

                        • Arguments:

                          • {Object} object
                          • {Boolean} prepend (optional) : Whether question mark should be prepend. Defaults to true

                        • Returns:{String}

                        • Usage:

                        Converts a plain object to a string representing an URL query part (also known as Query String)

                        • Example:
                        vm._.param({ key: 'bar', answer: 42 });
// => "?key=bar&answer=42"

                        WARNING

                        Doesn't handle array conversion nor recursion yet

                        vm._.param({ chunks: [1,2,3], a: {b: 'c'} });
// => "?chunks=1%2C2%2C3&a=%5Bobject%20Object%5D"

                        # vm._.args(array)

                        • Arguments:

                          • {Array} array

                        • Returns:{Object}

                        • Usage:

                        Transforms array to object using even values as keys and odd values as values

                        • Example:
                        vm._.args([0, 1, 'array', [], 'object', {foo: 'bar'}]);
// => {1: 2, array: Array(0), object: {foo: "bar"}}

                        # vm._.flatTree(tree, key, nodes)

                        • Arguments:

                          • {Array} tree
                          • {String} key (optional) : Defaults to 'id'
                          • {String} nodes (optional) : Defaults to 'children'

                        • Returns:{Array}

                        • Usage:

                        Flattens tree using key as identifier to ignore duplicates and nodes as lookup children key

                        • Exemple:
                        const tree = vm._.flatTree([{ id: 1, children: [{id: 2}, {id: 3, children: []}] }]);
// => [{"id":1,"children":[{"id":2},{"id":3,"children":[]}]},{"id":2},{"id":3,"children":[]}]
console.log(tree.length);
// => 3

                        # vm._.propsValidator(component, route, addRouteQueryInParams)

                        • Arguments:

                          • {Object} component : Vue Instance
                          • {Object} route : Vue Router Route Object
                          • {Boolean} addRouteQueryInParams (optional) : Whether route query should be merged with route parameters. Defaults to false

                        • Returns:{Object}

                        • Usage:

                        Should be used as a props value for a RouteConfig object in order to ...

                        • Exemple:
                        import Home from '@/views/Home';
import _ from '@triotech/vue-core/src/lib/plugins/_';

export default [{
  path: '/',
  name: 'home',
  component: Home,
  props: _.propsValidator.bind(_, Home)
}];

                        # vm._.queryPropsValidator(...args)

                        • Usage:

                        vm._.propsValidator(component, route, true) alias

                        • Exemple:
                        import Home from '@/views/Home';
import _ from '@triotech/vue-core/src/lib/plugins/_';

export default [{
  path: '/',
  name: 'home',
  component: Home,
  props: _.queryPropsValidator.bind(_, Home)
}];

                        # vm._.Y(function)

                        • Arguments:

                          • {Function} function

                        • Returns:{Function}

                        • Usage:

                        Permits to use the IIFE ES5 Idiom in ES6 by injecting a closure using the Y Combinator function

                        • Example:
                        const fib = vm._.Y(next => num => num <= 1 ? num : next(num - 1) + next(num - 2));
const fib9 = fib(9);
// => 34
